Overview.Summary: The Croatian parliamentary election in 2024 is set to take place in seven phases between April 19 and June 1, with results being declared on June 4 (1). The ruling party, HDZ, won the election but without a majority (3), prompting concerns of political trading (5). The election is seen as significant for rooting out corruption and overhauling the judiciary (4), and the date of the election has been declared a non-working day in Croatia (6). There is also a presidential election and European election set to take place in 2024 (9, 10).

Timeline.Text: Croatia's ruling HDZ party wins the parliamentary election but without a majority, according to preliminary results.
The first exit polls for the Croatian parliamentary election indicate a tight race, with the ruling HDZ party projected to win the most seats.
The election for the 11th convocation of the Croatian Parliament is held, with the HDZ party on course to win the most seats but less than in 2020.
An overview of pre-election polls for the Croatian parliamentary election shows a tight race between the HDZ and SDP parties.
Croatian lawmakers vote in a new government that marks a shift to the right ahead of the EU parliamentary election.
The 2024 Indian general election, the largest-ever election in history, begins with voting taking place over seven phases.
The 2024 Indian general election, which lasts for 44 days, officially ends with votes being counted and results declared on June 4th.
The results of the 2024 Indian general election are declared, with the winning party securing a majority in the Lok Sabha.
An interview with the leader of the OiP party, who is running on an anti-corruption platform, is published ahead of the Croatian parliamentary election.
The Croatian parliamentary election takes place, with multiple parties vying for seats in the 11th convocation of the Croatian Parliament.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Croatian parliamentary election is set to take place on April 17, 2024 (9, 19). The current ruling party, HDZ, is expected to win but without a majority (5, 9). The election was called after the dissolution of parliament on March 14, 2024 (2). The election is significant as it marks a tilt to the right in another European Union nation (11). There is also a presidential and European election taking place in Croatia in the same year (12). The election is set to be the largest-ever election in history, lasting 44 days (3).
